186040568.review: Its strange to me that the ratings for this game have gone from very positive to mostly positive over the years and mixed recent reviews despite the game not changing at all. It seems that people may be judging this game through a different lens now but I do not know what that would be. Regardless while this game isn't perfect its a beautifully crafted fun little arcade space rogue-like. The game play is great and perfect for sitting down and going through a few sectors for short sessions, upgrading your ship and unlocking new load outs and abilities in subsequent runs. Something I noticed playing this vs other rogue-likes is I never really get upset when I die in this one, it always feels deserved. Whether I took on an Okkar Corvette thinking I was stronger than I was or I stumble upon an ancient alien being that zaps me from existence because I got too curious, its all part of the experience and you spend your credits upgrading one of the 4 unique ships and start again to stumble upon new things. There's definitely some FTL inspiration here but its not nearly as punishing (not to say this game can't be pretty challenging). If you don't like rogue like games this will not be for you. But if you want a time killer that will immerse you and take you on some great adventures then this is definitely worth a meager $20. As a side note the $10 DLC is highly recommended and adds even more replayability although it definitely could've been a free update.

185993204.review: Once again Steam forces us into black and white. This is a good game for what it is, and I will continue to play it. But issues with its rugged devotion to the rogue-like trend and the DLC/pricing stop it from reaching its full potential. The game feels barebones without the DLC and then when you get it all of the sudden you have story, it feels like the way the game was meant to be played. It's a shame they locked it behind a paywall. Wish I could give a thumbs up on this one but can't.

185987184.review: На часы можете не смотреть, купил игру после того как наиграл в пиратку. Разработчики создают настоящие шедевры так что их не стыдно поддержать. Один из лучших космосимов, потрясающий рогалик и просто крутая игра. Хардкорный режим так вообще игру на новый уровень переносит. Из минусов могу сказать только что не очень интересна для перепрохождений.

185763901.review:
Fun space sim x roguelite dungeon crawler (no it's not a simulator, its space fantasy starfighter game like bsg/star wars)
i.e. dynamically generated 3D open nothingness with a cool skybox, and asteroids, and a few space stations + enemies.
Simple WASD arcade flight controls, you can strafe around in space head to head, so I guess it's 6dof enough,
Wing Commander shields + hull healthpools, guns and missiles.
It's not very deep though.
The plot doesn't keep you on the edge of your seat, since after all that dying I forgot about the motivation of the main character, you play as clone each time you die. I'm getting bored after 20 hours.

185359310.review:
[H1] ループで強くなれ [/H1]

端的に表現するならば、スペースコンバットシミュレーターにローグライク要素を放り込んだ作品。

限られた広さのランダム生成マップを探索し、敵と戦い、合間に採掘して資源を得たら、ジャンプして次のマップを目指す。
のんびりしていると敵がジャンプアウトしてくるので手早く探索を切り上げたいのだが、基本的にはアップグレードの武器も燃料も、探索で手に入れるか敵の残骸から引っ剥がすしかないのが面倒なところ。

手に入れた資源やパーツで機体の修理やアイテムの製作が可能なのだが、燃料マネジメントを含めてかなりシビアな難易度になっており、だいたいはコンポーネントが壊れかけた機体とギリギリの燃料で飛ぶことになる。

スペースコンバットシムとしてはオーソドックスな作りで、敵もなかなかに手ごわい。
射撃をしっかり当ててくるので、まっすぐブースターを吹かすだけでは逃げ切れないことが多い印象だ。

死んだら最初からやり直しだが、稼いだお金で永続強化する要素があるので、ちょっとずつ改善していく感じだろうか。

面白いタイトルではあるが、戦闘で無双できる種類のゲームではないので、ややストレスがある。

184693146.review:
Very nice dogfighting with very good controls. You can (and must) dodge incoming fire by strafing (in all 4 directions). The only game I know that actually says "best played with keybord & mouse". And that works fine! I don't know what problems some reviewers came upon, but the flying feels really good and the controls are perfect imho.

Between runs (when you die) you buy improvements to get stronger and get farther next time. You have the choice between 3 ships after you bought them, some improvements are shared (pilot-improvement), some only count for one type of ship. Every time you manage to get to a new sector you haven't reached before, you get to see the next part of the story. Just a few lines & pictures and sometimes a video, but interesting enough.

I usually don't like roguelites, but this one is actually really fun. It is hard (for me at least), but between runs you can switch between easy / normal / hard, so if you hit a wall, just turn it down for a while and the fun will come back.

如果你没有玩过浴火银河2（GOF2），那你倒是可以购买下来看一看，内容对于一位想体验自由太空RPG且是亲自驾驶飞船在太空自由翱翔看风景的玩家来说足够了。
但问题是，许多人都是听说过浴火银河并且玩过的的人来说，这个游戏不值得购买，首先是飞船数量，如果你没有购买DLC的话，只有三架，对比浴火银河2的几十架来说太少；其次，自由度太低，前往下一处不能自由选择，不能自由选择星系，剧情与体验粘合性不高...
上述的都可以不看，如果你想体验儿时的感觉，去买二，别买一。

184171887.review:
Okay so, i bought Everspace 1 and two in a bundle, and while 2 was a masterpiece, Everspace 1 almost made me refund the whole thing.
Here´s why.

First of all, this game plays rather smooth. Can´t complain here, also the environments are both beatiful to look at and fun to navigate. Then we have a pretty good sountrack, a solid voice cast and a really intrigiung plot about clones and amnesia. I know, tropey, but it works out.
So what went wrong?
Well, remember that one kid in your class that treated glue like a five star meal?
That kid apparently was in charge of the game design, and now we ended up with a rogue like. And not even a good one.

First of all, what´s so great about games like Dead Cells or Risk of Rain? Those games are fun from minute 1 onwards. They let you play them to the fullest, while you unlock new stuff on the way. And even if a run fails, the gameplay is still motivating enough to lure you back in.
That´s not the case here. Your first dozen runs will be an unfun pain, like wathcing a documentary in school, knowing full well there´ll be a test about it. You are simply too weak to get anything done, and maybe some games get away with only getting good after 10 hours, but this is a roguelike.
This problem becomes apparent when you look at the Energy System. In Everspace 2, each of your weapons and your engine have seperate energy sources, meaning you can switch between weapons to avoid being defenseless and also to run if the situation calls for it. Also there was a cruise drive that let you skip large distances, being a savior for the pacing.
In Boring Space, everything, even your toilet share the same energy, and that won´t be much starting a new game. You can´t boost to your target as you´ll be caught without energy to shoot back if you´re attacked, and if you run out of energy mid fight? Tough luck. Die and come back later, loser. This is Everspace 1, fun only exists in the sequel.
Oh and also, there´s a damage system for critical components. If even you engine, weapons, life support or anything else is just mildly damaged, you might as well fly into the next meteor because you can kiss that run goodbye.
This is such a terrible design decision and seeing how Everspace 2 turned out, even the developers seem to agree with me here.

Everspace 1 wants to be an arcade game like Ace Combat, while also being some sort of a light sim with its energy and damage system. Too bad what this game didn´t want to be was being good.

I´d rather fly into the sun/10

183943155.review:
I would love to recommend this, it came so close.
It's a roguelite where you are in a spaceship and do dogfights and stuff.
Gives me big descent 3 vibes, just that it's open space and not mines.
And mostly it is fine.
But the game has two things that destroy my liking of it and double handedly change this from a recommend to a do not recommend.
Firstly is the fuel. You need special fuel to travel between systems. That would be fine. That fuel being rather rare would also be fine. But in most of my attempts, the fuel was not just rare, it was non-existant. ONCE, yes, a single time, I found one of those fuel rocks from the tutorial. Exactly one time in 5 hours of play. In the other attempts there were sometimes vendors that sold way too little fuel. You will run out and that may be the end of your run.
Second is the enforced time limit. Spend too long in a level, likely in the search of fuel, and enemies spawn that quickly kill you.

If either fuel was just rare instead of the stuff of legend, or if you actually got to fullly explore the areas with no time limit and perhaps find more of those fuel rocks, this would likely have been a recommend.
As it is, I'm glad I got it on winter sale for a buck, because then I can say it's well worth it, but I'd be pssed if I paid full price
